title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 8.2
body:
Hey everyone and welcome to Patch 8.2, the second patch of the season!

I’m Riot Novalas & I’m a QA Analyst on Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who work on Core Gameplay playing new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they’re released. It’s our job to test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we’re introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun.

Patch Chat serves as an opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks.
You can find information on the most recent patch by following this link:
https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-82-notes

In this patch, we've given Evelynn, Kha'Zix, and Vayne some nerfs. Ornn isn't unstoppable anymore, btw. Jinx received some changes to her play pattern. Nunu and Sona got some love! Sightstone, as an item, as well as all of it's upgrades are now gonezo and your support items now transform into a warding item!

Ask us ANYTHING about 8.2! Any changes that you have questions about? Maybe our favorite rune builds? Or how often we execute to jungle camps? We're also down to just chat, though! 

Disclaimer: We have no insight on upcoming/future skins.

replies.body: How do you guys feel about making changes to marksmen to make them better at sustained damage, while taking away their burst? I know a lot of people have been asking for this for a while. For instance, Vayne's tumble could be changed to add very little bonus damage initially, but multiple tumbles within a period of time would cause it to ramp up.

I think it depends on the champion. While Marksman are in general the premier sustained damage class, I think the class is a lot more boring overall if we shoehorn them all into one strength/playpattern. Things are more fun when we have burst champions like Jhin/MF as counterpoints to the long range auto attackers like Tristana/Xayah. Sometimes there are outliers like Shiv IE Vayne, and we often to look to rectify those (the Vayne nerfs we just did lowering her AD from her Ult, as well as the previous change we made to Tumble that made the bonus AD not apply to her crits).

I'm sorry, but I disagree simply because presently _all_ ADC's have insane burst, easily being able to dish out 600 dmg per hit and averaging 1 hit every .5 - .75 seconds.

Burst mages have to pay through the nose to get 1800 damage with high mana costs, long cd's and expensive items while ADC's can get the same amount of burst for less gold and more reliability (no skill shots) and far higher up time.

I have to agree with Thryale. Nothing is more annoying than being equally fed as a Jhin, Caitlyn, Tristana or MF and dying in literally 2 hits. There's not much you can do to counter that damage unless you're a tank.

The state Tristana and MF are in are really puzzling.

Tristana is an ADC with A) an attack speed skill B) long range C) a gap closer/disengage C) another disengage/enemy knockback D) high AoE burst. She's got a tool for every weakness an ADC should have. It's hard to run from her, it's hard to chase her and it's hard to out-damage her. But it IS easy to die trying to fight her, so there's that.

MF is an ADC with A) movement speed buff/passive B) AoE Slow C) MASSIVE AoE dmg D) MASSIVE single target dmg. Different kit than Tristana but basically the same concept. Hard to run from her, hard to catch her (although easier than Tristana) and pretty damn difficult to out-damage her.

I want to know what Riot was thinking when designing these reworks. It's fine if an ADC has a few of these mechanics, but to create an "everything you need" kit was probably not the best idea in hindsight.

Predictions on how the META would shake up in SoloQ and pro-play?

**Safe Bet: **
I think the biggest thing in 8.2 that will shake up the meta is the new sightstone changes. I'm gonna predict that AP supports (Brand, Xerath) will rise in soloqueue play rate now that they can get Sorc Shoes/Haunting Guise significantly quicker. I also expect the lack of early vision to open up a lot of aggressive options for junglers for the first ten minutes. There's also big potential for other roles to grab support items, so we'll be keeping an eye out on its poachability.

**Risky Bet: **
I predict that with the Klepto + Vayne/Ezreal nerfs, Jinx will move up to be a top pick in soloqueue and competitive games.
So you think the recent buffs are enough for her not to be outshone by Tristana and Twitch, as she usually is in a crit scaling ADC meta?
In all honestly, probably not. I think it's more likely that we'll be back to poke ADCs that can use meteor (MF, Varus) or the usual crit-scalers (Twitch,Trist). A man can dream though...

Don't you think Twitch should be on the radar for nerfs again? Haven't he been consistently too strong for too long?

For the last 1.5 years I can remember, I don't think Twitch's winrate has EVER droppped below 52%, even during unfavorable lethality metas. 

Isn't a meta-independent permanent 52-55% winrate champ(who is at 54% right now) worth looking into? That seems to be is a consistent, evident excess of power that should be trimmed down.

Even if pros don't pick him often this is an ADC balance change that's well justified for solo queue(as is the case with Vayne just now).

However if I'm wrong about Twitch being OP and internal data/analysis show otherwise, I'd like to know that I'm being too biased.

Personally, I don't believe these two champions should be on the nerf radar right now for two reasons.

1) Data aggregate websites like op.gg and lolalytics.com for 8.1 suggest winrates closer to 50% (Compared to the Vayne outlier at 54%). Internal data also reveals around a 52% winrate when using optimal runes, which I think is appropriate. 

2) I think it would be better to wait and see how the bot lane meta shakes up after the plethora of changes in patch 8.2. Should be cognizant of the levers than can affect Twitch/Tristana before we go for the jugular. 

I do think a meta-independent champion with >55% wr should be looked into, but I'm not convinced that Twitch or Tristana fit the bill just yet. That being said, we should definitely put these champs on the radar if they fill the void that Vayne/Ezreal will undoubtedly leave behind. We'll just have to wait and see how the meta pans out.

Hope this made sense. Let me know what you think!

Hey man thanks alot for this very well thought out response. What you said makes sense. And from data from opgg and lolanalytics on Twitch for patch 8.1 it indeed seems that he WAS reasonable. And it's fair to say that we should wait to see how he pans out in 8.2 to see if they're going to replace Vayne/Ezreal as being OP, or just slightly above average. 

However I have one more question. I use champion.gg to look at winrates. And that's where I see a yearly long 52-55% winrate on Twitch(usually 53ish). How come it's so different from the other two big websites? Is it just a bad resource? Which websites are most accurate according to internal data? I wanna know which one to use in the future.

Thanks!

No problem!

Sorry, I don't have a clue as to which website is the most accurate (I'm guessing each website collects data from the API in a different way). 

My advice would be to be as informed as possible by comparing the statistics of multiple sources and reaching your own conclusion.
Question for Cobra about Swain, what's your build, runes and maxing order and can you share any scrapped spells that you tested?

I've used two builds - one is RoA, Liandry, Zhonyas, Void, DCap, Boots and the other swap RoA for Morello. 

I think Unsealed Spellbook is optimal on him but also thinks he makes great use of Phase Rush. In the gameplay videos you've seen on his reveal page and the ones in his champion spotlight that are yet to be seen I have Phase Rush because US was bugged on our internal environments :P. 

Max order depends. Q max first and then depending on matchup and team comps I'd say you either max W or E second. Probably E most of the time.

In terms of scrapped spells? Hmmm, we did A LOT of exploration with Swain. One example....earlier in development his passive replaced his trinket slot with a raven that you could place on the map at almost global range. The raven would act as a ward with a speed shrine on top of it (scuttle crab). The idea was that you were supposed to use it tactically, but we wound up realizing the optimal play was to either place it between towers midlane so jungle could move faster and mid could get to lane faster OR placing it in lane as a mid laner and just using it as a perma-ghost in lane.

How does he fare with the other Catalyst items like Protobelt and GLP?

Also, how would you say he performs top vs mid? Are there any matchups in particular that he struggles with?

Well Protobelt doesn't build of Catalyst, but I think he's ok with GLP. I generally prefer RoA for more health later in the game, but I can see GLP working.

I think he's better mid than top but can definitely be played up there as well. I think Swain will struggle with moderate to long range mid laners like Syndra, Ori, Xerath, etc. and in top lane he'll probably struggle against champions who can repeatedly engage like Jax and Irelia. I would say his matchups are somewhat comparable to Lissandra.
Lucian changes are in for testing

Now i know this doesnt mean much.  But i personally feel Lucian should absolutly not be played in a solo lane, and pushing him in those directions is a great way to make him completely unviable.

I'd like to talk about the Master Yi changes in testing. Mainly the Meditate changes.

What were your impressions when playing with this uh... buff? Reactions from Yi players have varied between "skeptical that this buff will do anything" and ["insulted because we were expecting something more meaningful."](https://www.reddit.com/r/YIMO/comments/7sp63g/cowseps_thoughts_on_yi_changes_on_pbe/) I tried it out myself on the PBE and I don't feel like the on-hit healing and CDR were worth using 50 mana and a 25 second cooldown. And [as I explained in another post,](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/iiuLcEGZ-on-the-master-yi-buffs) I don't think it encourages tactically sound Master Yi play.

The compensating nerfs to Meditate were harsh in my opinion as well. The healing when you're low health has almost been halved so using Meditate in combat became worse than it already was.

Lower mana cost on Alpha Strike is appreciated though.
It's an interesting changelist but not necessarily the changelist that'll ship. We're planning on doing further exploration on Yi changes.
Hello! Any thoughts on Syndra's performance after receiving bug fixes not too long ago?
I think Syndra is still in a less than ideal spot and could use some help.
It seems like this patch was very good for Kayn overall, do you see him raising with other junglers getting nerfed, no more targons adcs and less early vision bot?

I'm still doubting Kayn coming to dominate, at least in higher elos. It's pretty vital for the jungler to have a solid impact around 5-10 minutes and Kayn doesn't really turn on until 10-15. I've been playing him a LOT recently and I've personally not had too much success. Think the current top jungle pool, despite some nerfs, will largely remain the same and they decimate Kayn.
Who are the top junglers? Should I always invade lvl 2 Kayn, or are there times when I should farm?

Think top junglers right now, high elo primarily, are Nidalee, Kha'Zix, Evelynn, Shyvana, and Xin Zhao. 

I personally don't opt into level 2 invading on Kayn. You lose a - lot - of matchups pre transformation so I find it too risky. I'd focus on farming and counterganking when opportunities arise.

I remember Jhat doing a breakdown of Kayn when he came out, saying that he has some of the highest base stats which are supposed to help him succeed against other junglers early, and then transforming gives him the power he needs to succeed mid/late. Is this not the case? Or is the base stat advantage just not enough to help him succeed early when he's supposed to?

I'd say his early dueling is quite weak. However, his clear speed is pretty nice (and he really excels at farming raptors), which can give him the tools to counter-jungle. Its probably a good idea to vacate the premises if the enemy team shows up though :)
So is he just poorly made or out of meta?
Neither, imho. I think he just succeeds more at lower elos because the impact of early game is less catastrophic.
I think the only thing that made Evelynn too strong was her ability to kill tanks but this nerf is just damaging her gameplay overall so why chose to nerf her that way.
This nerf directly impacts her tank-killing abilities since it hits her at her max health damage.

Seems perfectly playable in high elo solo queue. Pretty common pick.

I can't remember where, but I know we posted that we have no intention of changing Ryze ultimate.
Just wondering that on PBE when you R zhonyas with ryze it cancels your ultimate alot of people in the ryze reddit are worried, is it a bug?
Not a bug. I confirmed in a thread on /r/RyzeMains for verification. We're currently planning on shipping this change.

I recognise that it's going to be a painful change for many ryze players, but I was always confused that it worked in the first place. 

The spell says "If Ryze becomes unable to cast or move, Realm Warp is cancelled.", and stasis is an effect that prevents casting/moving so it always felt wrong to me that it worked to begin with.

@riot Wittrock / whoever

In reference to Volibear..My opinion as a Volibear Main 

* I suggest that his Q gets some form of inherent tenacity, or it could break cc when activated. This fits from a logical standpoint (Bear's can enrage and become quite literally unstoppable IRL).

* I understand this is way too strong of a change to just have him be completely unstoppable, so Instead I threw out the idea of Volibears Q negating the first cc effect tossed his way while in charge. This would allow him to not be so easily kited, but also keep him balanced in teamfights.  

* Perhaps a movement speed buff when under 50% health, and charging towards the direction of enemy champions? 

* I do like the idea of a small knockback on his E which was a previously discussed change. 

* An attack speed buff on his w was also discussed. I don't believe this is the right direction for the champion. 

I look forward to what you guys end up deciding. I feel his biggest weakness isnt necessarily his damage.. but his survivability. His passive heals a good amount, and I really like how it influences his playstyle, but with the onset of the disengage meta, he's too easily kite-able. His character model is huge, thus he's a bit harder to sidestep with. I think if we give his Q a buff to improve his ability to gap close, he's in a decent spot. I would really love to hear more about what the plans are for {{champion:106}}. Even if its not detailed, just a general thought process would be appreciated. 
 
Thanks,
Volibears Keeper
